wna-JtKzuFDwg6JlRWMaFg.text: So delicious! The mansion is adorable and I enjoyed the ambiance with the wine cellar and the decor on the walls. The food is very good, my husband and I went for our 2 year anniversary and then had to come back two weeks later with my parents because of how good it was.   We got the arancini and meatballs for an appetizer, both had great flavor. We each had a different dish and I loved that the pizza had to be cut by the patrons, very Italian!   The only complaint I have is the noise level and sitting by the pizza bar. We were at a table but it was close to the kitchen so very warm and don't love open kitchen concepts, I don't need to see what goes on back there. It's also very loud. Other than that I'll be back many more times!

M4tpYGeZoeuLV_uPnpaXoQ.text: I really liked the atmosphere here.  Alive, but respectful of privacy.  Pizza Bar is worth it.  Chef efficient with an expert crew.  Very happy to go again.  Didn't think I'd like squash blossoms... ;) but the preparation was fresh.  Yes.

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate Marshmallow torte.  Candied sweet potato... More of that please!
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Barramundi on beet risotto.  So good
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wild Boar Rigatoni.  So good.  Shareable.

9BYF8nmgrb9FUMtnlQwjtw.text: Overpriced and Underwhelmed.  We came here to celebrate my daughter's 18th birthday.  She made the reservation and told them it was her birthday.  I called an hour before our arrival to make sure they knew it was her birthday.  No candle in her dessert and a stupid excuse from our server saying she was "so busy putting in orders she forgot to make sure they put a candle on her dessert ". Really?? It's a Wed night in the summer! Please!  Food is good but not worth the price point.  Also I felt a little rushed by the servers and it was not like they were going to turn our table that night.  Overall, save yourself the time and money as there are much better restaurants in Charlotte.  Will not return and  will not recommend. Disappointed.

-fynkpJVATrwAHJfu2WFVA.text: Disappointed! Got the lamb special this past weekend. There was so much FAT on my piece of lamb I had difficulty cutting it. I literally had a pile of FAT on the side of my plate when our server came to take our plates away. The bread was good, but why do they bring it in those little bags? In my opinion, a waste of paper. It would be better in a simple bread basket. My salad was good, and I'm thankful for that otherwise I would have left hungry. Our server also brought me the WRONG wine. I told her what kind of wine I liked, and she brought me something  I did not ask for. I did not want to complain in front of my dinner companion, but I would not return to this place.

PRrTJUkUAQUJAIWpUyDbZA.text: This was my second visit to Stagioni... I left disappointed this time. My husband ordered the pizza with sausage , which there was only San Marzano tomatoes on two of the slices which was very disappointing. My dish was fillo dough with a crab sauce, which lacked crab and the tips of the fillo dough were burnt. For the prices of the items served this was a huge disappointment!

S3kOgbyDS67n-Om4Ur09Ww.text: This place makes Charlotte better.  Here is the low down...  the parking lot is tiny, better drive a European car to park!  Once inside, you are greeted by a hostess with several high-top tables. They will then take you to your table in the back, of our made a reso (highly suggested).  The dining area a very spacious and is opened to the kitchen where you can see the cooks prepare your food.  There are even bar seating options where you can sit almost in the kitchen.  The cooks serve you directly from the kitchen; it doesn't get more fresh than that!  I appreciate the open concept, because many time it can be unnerving not knowing what is exactly going on behind those closed kitchen doors.     The atmosphere is very warm, yet dark. I'd say it's a lovely place for a date or a cozy dinner with close friends.  The drink menu has a huge range of wines as well as specialty drinks.  I have always been amazed and pleased by the level of professional service they offer their patrons.  They do not hire jut anyone, and that is very much appreciated.  Their staff are very knowledgeable about the food and are clearly invested in you having a pleasant experience.  Our waiter made some fine selections for us off the wine menu.  As a vegetarian, he even offered some combinations that made my tastebuds extremely satisfied.  #TrufflePasta  He even told us about wine tasting a they have started hosting, which would be of great interest to me.    I certainly suggest a reso! This can be hard to get in otherwise.   You may need a European car to park here, but you will need a mini van to take you away.  The food is so delicious you will overeat, that's a promise.

LG6w_bxhh2MqujWNm2GAEQ.text: Excellent dinner.  Nice Space.  Great service.  Beignets are a must for desert.

0lRXUiXXOlRRsWUa3VqbcQ.text: Excellent excellent excellent-  Service was pleasant and helpful and food was flavorful and delicious!  Try the octopus!

HbUuldndTw80U5Z85dZXqg.text: Overall, very expensive for what you get and seems like they are trying to project themselves above their pay grade. There's a little bit of an identity crisis for a pizza/pasta restaurant with a five page wine selection and $30+ entrees.   Atmosphere is very nice, restaurant is well configured and the open kitchen is great.   We ordered a number of items and got a bottle of wine plus a couple of desserts, coffee, etc.   $48 for a $12-15 bottle of Ormanni Chianti was a little ridiculous.   Lobster bisque, the dark green color was completely off-putting, flavor was good, except for the potato chips that just seemed odd. Also, be prepared for, literally, zero pieces of lobster.   Stuffed squash flowers were amazing, beautiful presentation and well balanced.   Octopus, burnt, fishy tasting and totally lost in a bedding of celery, sliced beans, and pork rinds?  Mussels, drowned in cream sauce. They also seemed a little over cooked. Decent flavor in the sauce but way too thick.   Scallop Spaghetti, pretty much a total disaster. The scallops tasted like they were cooked separately, were rubbery and way over salted. The pasta was in a very thick cream sauce with some bacon? which may have been supposed to be pancetta.   Broccolini, amazing except for two of the ~10 stalks that were drowned in salt. It was really confusing.   Mushrooms, amazing. Well cooked, delicious. Probably my favorite item of the night and it was a side.   Raspberry sorbet, was what you would expect, very tiny portion compared to the other dessert.   Zeppolis, fantastic. Perfectly cooked and powdered, classic taste I remember from when I was a kid. They serve you 5-6 huge pieces which looked really funny next to the two golf ball sized scoops of sorbet!  Not what I expected from a $200+ dinner at a place with a sign out from that says "Pizza, Pasta, Vino" and servers in T-Shirts.

00c1MZ_WqkrAv7RPAUIjfA.text: 05/2017 Really great date night restaurant. I love that everything is local and seasonal. The pork shoulder is delicious.   I've heard that the lobster mac n cheese is good but felt sick after trying it myself.   Great customer service, will definitely return and try some other items, maybe not yhe seafood though.  08/2018 sooooo good! I've eaten here 3 times since my last review. Did not disappoint. Everything was perfect! The waiter was so nice and our food was perfection.  Try the Lamb 3 ways special and the diablo shrimp risotto (delicious spin on shrimp and grits).  Our absolute favorite date night spot!

pmbT4bTSdss2_3w_LQEYXQ.text: Tonight was different than my previous experiences. Same server, different food. Different service!! All middle of the road to poor. I don't mind expensive food if its good. I know that you can't always be patient and chipper to everyone, if I'm paying you better not be short with me... We were thrilled to come enjoy all that we've had before. 2 Zucchini flowers, for the price of what used to be 3??  Not so much a changed menu, but maybe different chef?? Just dissapointed. I'm fluent in food and good service especially Italian. When I said I didn't enjoy my food the waitress asked me if I wanted a box..?? It was like if I asked for anything other than what was easiest for her that she had an attitude. We won't be back and I will no longer give a good recommendation.

hV3WJwvb4mVWqNk880Y-mg.text: I generally try to rate restaurants based purely on quality without letting price factor in too much, but for Stagioni I just can't do it. The food was delicious, but incredibly expensive with very small portion sizes. My wife and I each got a pasta dish, with maybe 6 oz of pasta, neither with protein, both about $30. My wife added pancetta which was an additional $7. We each got a glass of wine and I got a salad, total was about $140.   The food was very good, but the prices for what you get are almost laughable. If the service was great it might be worth it, but ours was average and we felt pretty rushed. Overall not the best experience; I think there are better values to be had elsewhere.

XQL-M8F6rP5hiPmmqRiP_Q.text: I'd hoped Charlotte might have finally created a place that was a warm, cultural, culinary experience with local farm raised foods, but alas, it's loud, which colored my experience. The food was excellent and my grouper and the oyster aperitvo was divine. The restaurant is located in a beautifull old house in residential Eastover, an old Charlotte neighborhood. The service was good but servers changed midmeal. We went on a Thursday evening at 6:30, thinking it would be fairly quiet for an intimate meal. But there were families with children, and many groups of reveling singles. I did love seeing the portrait of Blanche Gormajenko, as I grew up in the neighborhood and the stories  of her were legendary. But it is propbably not a place I would return, all things considered.

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grouper.
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mackerel radish aperitivo.
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oysters aperitivo. Memorable and delicious.

pX3auVLKozM90ufn4RIcUQ.text: It's probably more 3.5 stars for me. I wasn't exactly impressed but it wasn't horrible either.   The service was very friendly which goes a long way -- everyone we interacted with was super nice and easy going. The food was, over all, "meh" for me. We split a pizza as an appetizer, and it was great. Our entrees were underwhelming -- so much so that I can't remember exactly what we got.   The thing that really killed it for me was the vibe. I don't quite know how to explain it but it was like it wanted to be upscale but didn't have anything to back it up. I can do upscale or low key dining, even downright dive joints, so it wasn't that I felt this place was beneath me by any means. It was more so that it was trying to be something that it didn't need to. Just wasn't my scene.   Final verdict is that I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone but if someone said they were going I wouldn't try to stop them. It could be we went on a night when this just weren't meshing. But I doubt I'll ever go back, considering all the other options in Charlotte that I know i really enjoy.

R5y5wtEZsmQxO2dDxABqlA.text: Oh how I love this restaurant. The seasonal menu never disappoints, and it is always unique. It's a cozy and intimate atmosphere, and we've always had great service. Make a reservation because it often is full. It's well worth it.

z7RVjmmCmNH0euldjvJetw.text: I haven't been here in several years so I thought I'd pop in before the dinner crowd in a Saturday evening. I got there just before 6 and the dinner crowd had almost filled the place. I asked for a seat at the pizza bar and was quickly sat. It was half full. This is a neat area where you can watch the kitchen crew at their craft.  Took a few minutes, more than was comfortable to be greeted.  Finally, someone brought me water and I was ready to order a drink. He wasn't the server so he said someone would be over. In my opinion this was a miss, he should have just taken the drink order so the service would have been seamless. Anyhow, the server came over a few minutes later and took my wine order. I wasn't in a hurry as I intended to order a salad, pasta and pizza. The local baby greens was the salad I ordered. It was really good. Love, love the pickled onions and the goat cheese softened the bitterness of the balsamic and onions. I also ordered the Tonnarelli.  The pesto softened the pepper but I wonder why no one seems to do a True cacio de pepe in CLT. It was topped with shaved truffles which was nice but I am not a huge fan and probably didn't appreciate them as much as I should have given the $29 price. After sitting at the pizza bar for over an hour, I couldn't resist a pizza. I ordered the Stracciotella. It was good but I swear the simpler pepperoni pies coming out of the kitchen looked awesome. Overall my experience was ok. Service was lacking in that at times the sever just missed checking in. And yes, I ordered the box of Cannoli which the best was the pistachio one. I'd return to sit solo at the pizza bar or with a couple of friends so that we could order and share other entrees. One last thing, watching the pizza guy not only do pizza but also a lot of other items that are roasted in the oven was cool. (Actually it's pretty warm sitting there in front of the heat so be aware if that is not your thing).

PLn2hnIkWOmaE7_jDBZ_2g.text: Definitely one of those places that seems fancy, but it certainly isn't. We were visiting family at one of the (many) hospitals in the area, and were absolutely not dressed up. If anything, we were even dressed more casually than normal. Just to be certain, I checked up front, and they were fine with it - though they did put us at the back at the pizza bar, so there is that. And we were right outside of the men's room, so take that for what you will.  The good news it that you are (generally) facing the pizza oven, and not the men's room, but if you turn around, it is there in all its glory, should you choose to enjoy it.  Beyond that, the staff is very helpful, and they will serve you, location and all, no matter what you are wearing. So that's awesome. The food selection is solid, even though we were mostly sticking to the left side of the menu - no main courses here. Just too much going on. The good news is that there is plenty there to keep you interested and full along the way.  Since we were there early, it made for a nice break, but as things filled up, it got a bit louder, and naturally the location we were in saw some more traffic, so there is that, but the service didn't falter, and the food came out on a decent pace. Definitely worth trying the place again when we have more time to enjoy. And perhaps make a reservation for a better seat.

UW6SbQUfl4pseAF4DijOQA.text: Stagionis is a great find in Charlotte. It's dim lighting and intimate atmosphere make it a great place for a romantic date night but I also observed some girls night outs as well. My husband had the radiatore and loved it. I had the mushroom pizza and it was great. It's definitely expensive and I will save my next visit for a special occasion. Pro-tip-We came here with friends in our bum clothes and I felt a little under dressed. Most of the people there were dressed up but the waiters wore t shirts and jeans so I didn't feel so bad.

NtpTtL99S_j2MfWmp54iYQ.text: By far, the best restaurant in Charlotte. Been here many times and always perfectly consistent!  The wait staff is always very knowledgeable!

329UjhPX6xAVFLl1ypjYEQ.text: Came here for dinner with a couple friends because it was rated a one of the top Italian restaurants in Charlotte.  It did not disappoint!  Beth was our waitress and she was prompt, informative, and delightful throughout the entire meal.  The cocktails were deliciously crafted. Bella Rossa and Smoke N Coco were a couple of the cocktails we tried and definitely flavorful.   We started off with the PEI Mussels, Local Baby Greens Salad, and the House Smoked Mackerel. All appetizers were mouth-wateringly tasty.   We then ordered a couple of their tasty and unique pizzas with a side of Char-grilled carrots which more than met our expectations.  Then my most favorite part of the entire meal was served: Espresso, a specialty dessert with rich chocolate and lovely hints of spice, and a homemade lady finger Tiramisu. This Tiramisu was the absolute best, hands down, I have ever had and my mouth is watering just thinking about it.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant and it's awesome staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Espresso, Tiramisu, specialty dessert

IiVI3Szl-sJ6Qez9qyNxaQ.text: Great service and an excellent atmosphere! We tried several of the pastas and had a spritz... really great dinner!

Mko9UYM67DjkUGl56zgjkg.text: A perfect evening to dine outdoors with friends at this beautiful Tuscan revival mansion! Wonderful ambiance! Upscale brown paper bags filled with thinly sliced airy, crispy bread is served with a carafe of rosemary-infused olive oil. Loved the bread, added salt & pepper to the oil, so the 2-3 slices I ate became a must! Especially with the bold, yet smooth chianti. They prepare creative dishes using local, seasonal flavors mixed with some Italian staples to make delicious & interesting meals. So go expecting to venture outside the usual Italian fare. Their menu constantly changes bc they cook with the seasons and whatever is fresh at the local farms. Really like this concept!  Now for the food:  Starter:  char-grilled octopus & sliced gigande beans atop a saffron aioli was very good & quite filling. It was all about the mixture of the ingredients bc the octopus alone was not the star. Primo: Truffle tagliatelle  lacked flavor & was alittle dry. I probably would have liked a sausage for added flavor, but at $32 for a one-person pasta dish ... that wasn't happening! Too bad there wasn't anymore room for dessert but I will go back to try more creations ... especially zeppole! Everyone was happy with everything they had, especially the warm asparagus salad & the primo, sweet potato cavatelli w.wild boar sausage, apples, collard greens & toasted pecans. All of their pastas, bread & sausage are made fresh, on site. Another nice concept! (GF is available) The 20% tip is already on the bill and bc of it, they make sure service is upto par. Service was excellent! Very knowledgable, assertive & mannerful which made for a great dining experience. Octopus+tagliatelle + 1 glass chianti w.tip just over $74. It's a treat ... an adventure I recommend trying.  4 bc I wasn't thrilled w.the truffle tagliatelle.

Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

onlKLIZKlU-7UbrMHp6agQ.text: A fantastic experience from service to food.   Situated in a historic old Charlottean mini-mansion, you'll find Stagioni. This place doesn't disappoint at all. After several visits here, it is absolutely one of the best spots in Charlotte that you don't ever hear anyone talk about.   Stagioni is a really nice hybrid of fine and semi-casual dining. They have found this balance that says "we are a nice restaurant, but most importantly we care about the food we serve". This is the first restaurant that has offered a fine dining experience, but also doubled as my casual go-to spot for delicious pizza and beer. The inside offers a quaint, intimate, and darker setting that will absolutely be the highlight of your evening out.   The appetizers are delicious as are the main pasta dishes. You can't go wrong with anything seafood-based here. Even the table bread and rosemary olive oil are phenomenal. The drink selection is interesting without being too fussy. They offer some craft cocktails, good wine, and good draft beers.  Now, it's time to talk about the pizza. This is the best pizza in Charlotte. Whether you're a deep dish, NY style, or Neapolitan style fan, you will quickly fall in love with Stagioni's pizza. It's thin, with the right amount of soft and crunchy. The toppings, the cheese, the sauce...it's incredible. It's also the first time I have ever been given scissors to cut a pizza, which is actually quite efficient.    You owe it to yourself to try this place. Restaurants like these are holding up the food and restaurant reputation for Charlotte. Without a doubt, an unwavering 5/5.

UvSsEyomL3W7AGV4OEYseQ.text: Worth Every Bite! We had a 8:15 reservation and I was dreading an Italian meal that late.  When we arrived we were promptly seated and our server couldn't not of been more helpful.  As we had already studied the menu we had a few questions and then the ordering began.  Everything came out in sync.  Are drinks arrived we enjoyed the bread and then followed by the apps and entrees.  We were so full we wanted to try dessert.   Instead of eating it there we got the Tiramisu to go.  They put the sauce on the side and it was divine after we got home and enjoyed it with a bottle of wine.

UtiAPKDV4IPHXucMkoKg6g.text: The ambiance is really nice in the restaurant. I love that they take reservations.  We were seated quickly and immediately brought waters.  The service was a 5 and our waitress was wonderful.    My rating on the food is a 3.5.  We order two hard cheeses and prosciutto.  This came with bread and was really delicious.    Our next course was the beet ravioli which was very unique and not what I expected but it was a very small portion.  For pasta we got the lamb rigatoni.  It was a little over cooked, but since I was our anniversary I didn't want to send it back.     For dessert we did the gelato sandwich.  My husband loved it but I didn't care for it.  The waitress brought us a small glass of champagne to celebrate our anniversary which was really nice.

rjNaGm7UtpdGmqcWxmYuKg.text: Neat place! Surprisingly good, but probably won't be back. It didn't really have enough variety for me.   Beth our waitress was very nice!  Hendrick gin a tonic's- excellently made! $14   I ordered the Angel hair pasta with fettuccini Alfredo- Absolutely wonderful sauce!!!! The pasta was pretty well done. I would have made this a regular place with different noodles. Andrew Dod, the chef, whipped up the sauce just for me! Incredible!! 5 stars to him. $15  Broccoli- was delicious, but some were charred heavily.  This gave it a crunchy dead dry taste. I picked around for the less done ones, and they were fabulous!  I specifically asked the waitress and she said there was nothing burnt about it, not so much! $6  My friend ordered the lobster gnocchi and she liked it, but the plate was tiny.  $30  $96 total

eOQuUITPhpRak16v2JmvDA.text: The food is mediocre, small and overpriced. Their menu seems interesting, but unfortunately the kitchen can't deliver.  I ordered a beet salad, which typically means a combination of heirloom beets covered with lime and oil. What I got instead were 5 thin slices of red beet covered up with lettuce leafs. The main course and the desert was no better.   Given the capabilities of the kitchen, if you must come here, I would stick with simple dishes like their pizza and skip anything that requires skill.

sN4g54mpv5Tr6STIAyrl4Q.text: Every.single.dish  GREAT Everything was just excellent, really excellent, includimg Kelly, our server (who recommended 2 great wines and a number of the dishes below and served them at exactly the right place)  I don't know how you can execute so many courses at that high level for a restaurant full of people.  Appetizer was a think sliced veal with tuna caper sauce, then sweet potato cavatelli, truffle pizza, shaved asparagus , risotto cake (crispy and delicious), fried cauliflower, and dessert (zeppoli) the lightest and most delicious fried dough (that description doesn't do it justice - beignet  like but lighter) with salted homemade caramel sauce - an amazing evening with a this meal as the centerpiece!

rRgyQcHo81mogkVUUjb7MA.text: Went for Valentine's Day and they had a set four course menu. Every course was nothing short of perfection, truly. I imagine the chef had poured considerable time and energy into creating not just the perfect selections, but perfectly paired selections. The waitstaff was friendly, kind, and attentive. We enjoyed watching the cooks, as they were very focused, working quickly and efficiently, yet were all smiling, talking to each other, and having a good time working together as a team. We were very happy with the red and white wines we had. I have to go back to the meal - it was absolutely exceptional, in every way: presentation, tastes, textures... We added an additional gratuity for the Head Chef, as we were genuinely appreciative; It truly was one of the best meals we have ever had.

-RLjBRR_eXT47ezc-_4CTg.text: Undeservedly snooty. For a place that makes you cut your own pizza, I was surprised when I came in on a Wednesday and was refused seating in the dining room. There were two of us, around 6 PM. While we had no reservation, they had no customers. We were told we could sit facing a black wall at a makeshift bar top seat or at the "pizza bar." I'm an average sized lady, I tried the pizza bar and the bar top came almost to my neck it was so high and the seat was so low. There was no shortage of servers as they were visibly standing around their empty dining room waiting for business. We were dressed fine, over 21...I'm still baffled. I snapped a few photos of the empty dining room for your viewing pleasure. Vote with your dollar people, don't give them your business and let them be snooty, alone, in their permanently empty dining room.

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

bCobsvy74h3lK9bI6m644Q.text: Great wine; food was fantastic; and service was excellent. Unfortunately the place is just really poorly designed. The dining space is an open concept with small tables and a long shared bench with little space between more small tables. The noise from the poor seating design is amplified by low dealings. It's like a great restaurant in a cramped bowling alley. Loved the food but won't return.

K_tbfs-pQWXs9lBGOCPDvA.text: One of the best restaurants in Charlotte my opinion. I am pretty particular when it comes to Italian restaurants, and this one is now at the top of my list. I went for dinner on a Thursday night, and I highly suggest making a reservation. The place was packed, and the noise level was very loud. However, the experience was still fantastic. We ordered a cheeseboard, the meatball appetizer, and Taglioni pasta entrees.  Our server was great, and made recommendations for the cheeseboard that were in my opinion, hard for anyone to dislike. The whipped honey and fruit spread on the board were unique and delicious.  The meatballs were so tender and full of flavor. The garlic toast that they placed on the side was very good, and the sauce was too. The pasta was cooked to perfection, and the meat sauce that accompanied it was amazing. Portions were the perfect size. Not too much, not too small. Had a chocolate mousse bar-like dessert that was also incredible. Just the right amount of sweetness. I can't wait to return for another five star experience!

ntN9dxqfpJH7P7vA46h30w.text: So this would EASILY be a 5 star review except for two things - 1) we sat in the main area and the acoustics are very odd, we could barely hear each other. Sit in the front room if you can. 2) the waiter tried to space out things but overdid it a bit. It was a very slow meal, probably took us 3 hours to eat apps, dinner and a dessert.  Otherwise, the food was spectacular. We loved the tomato salad, the cheese, meatballs and all of our pastas. Be sure to get the baked oysters too. I got the raw meat dish for my entree and loved it. I could not get over how tasty everything was. We also loved the bread in the paper bags. We took it home for sure.

FLQwuMRx0bEexzxOHzmTiA.text: Friday night my wife and I went in search of great pizza, having moved from NY in February and not having found any great pizza yet. We found it, and we found a lot more.  We were having a date night by eating at the bar with a nice cocktail. We were greeted by Ross who is way more than a bartender. He is a mixologist, greeter, quasi-entertainer and a great advertisement for Stagioni's. My wife has a Fresco 1926 cocktail (sort of a vodka gimlet with red wine floated on top) and it was a tasty as it was delicious. I had a Dark & Stormy and mine was also perfect.  We then settled in for the Pepperoni/sausage pizza. The pepperonis were the little ones that turn into little cups of moist pepperoni goodness and the sausage was house-ground. They were delicious toppings, but what really brought it all the way home was the cornmeal crust. Making the crust with cornmeal on the bottom actually allows the pizza to ride above the oven surface and let air under it while it cooks, making for a wonderful, crispy delicious crust. Add it all together and the pizza was outstanding. We were so thrilled to find this pizza, and we are definitely coming back.  That's when things really took an unexpected turn. We ordered the zeppoli's. If I told you this was one of the best things I ever ate, that's no lie. These ethereal balls of dough, fried and coated with powdered sugar are light as a feather. You split them with a fork, and then grab a half and stick it into this amazing salted caramel dipping sauce. This was just CRAZY good. If nothing else, go there and try this dessert. You will never regret it.  To sum it up, we found excellent pizza, not an easy find in Charlotte. But we found the best dessert ever in the bargain. And a great mixologist to boot. Five stars goes to the places that give me something I'ver never had before or can't get anywhere else. The zeppoli's and Ross puts Stagioni's in that five star category. We are GOING back!

azS2v3lqQT3IG24gDcoarw.text: Bruce Moffett knows how to create a good restaurant with outstanding menu items. All pastas are House-made and you can tell within the initial bite. Ingredients are sourced locally and used to put modern spins on classic Italian dishes! And who doesn't love complimentary warm bread and fresh olive oil to start out the night? The ambiance is absolutely lovely, cozy, and quaint.  The Squash Blossoms appetizer is to die for!! The blossoms are battered in Prosecco, and stuffed with a three cheese + herb blend, and sit atop radish aioli and espelette.   The pastas are divine! If you're a mushroom lover like me, the Truffle Tagliatelle is a great choice! It comes with Porcini Mushrooms, a vermouth butter sauce, truffle pecorino, and shaved truffles. The portion size is just right, too!  The pizzas are nice and thin, with a good crisp to them. They're famous pizza is the Asparagus pizza.   The wines are great, even with such a moderate list.

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Squash Blossoms
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Truffle Tagliatelle

1J06R_H4dmIKgFyqiqBUmA.text: This place might take the cake as my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. It's also one of those undiscovered gems so it makes it even better (esp if you've been anywhere in Southend). All their pizzas and pastas are homemade so I would def recommend sharing both because just ordering one or the other is too hard of a choice. The pizza comes with shears for cutting so be responsible...it's a big job. I can't let my girlfriend cut them anymore after last night's fiasco haha. Glad I got my pictures prior to that! Make sure you book a reservation and come hungry! Esp leave room for dessert...the zeppoli are heavenly. They are these pillowy balls of dough that you can dip into caramel sauce. Soo sooo good!!

Rd2polPqmlAHo8Lso5wIrw.text: This cozy Italian restaurant from chef Bruce Moffett features a menu full of charcuterie, small plates, creative pizzas, and a huge amount of pasta options. The food was all delicious and the service was some of the best we've ever had in Charlotte. A cool feature with the pizzas is cutting them yourself with giant scissors that are surprisingly much easier to use than a regular pizza cutter!  We started with the octopus (delicious even for the one person in our party who doesn't normally love octopus!), meatballs which were clearly made fresh recently, two pizzas, grilled parsnips (unique and delicious in a great pesto sauce), grilled cauliflower, and two pasta dishes. Would definitely recommend getting a bunch of plates like this and sharing, you will definitely leave very full! Pair it all with some creative and flavorful (and very flavor forward) seasonal cocktails and you'll have an amazing night out!

g7ug6B4JXlipnmkIeXtSvw.text: This place has been on my favorites list for a few years now. Consistently terrific food, good service and the ambiance is the kind you won't find anywhere else in Charlotte. It's the perfect small group dinner place, perfect date night spot! It's dark, it's cozy; perfectly intimate without being quiet or pretentious. 9 out of 10 time the service has been excellent, and 10 out of 10 times the food has exceeded expectations. Yes, it's a little pricey... but you really are getting what you pay for in terms of quality. You almost always need a reservation, and for the weekends I'd recommend you book ahead. You can't go wrong picking from the menu, but I usually end up getting at least one of the specials, and let's just say, it's always pretty special. The pizzas are on point, and my favorite is probably the Tartufi (think mushroomy... truffley goodness)  If you haven't been to this gem of a restaurant yet, now's probably a good time to give it a try!

CWi4K7NvjVlh5iaOf-3kbg.text: Oh my mother of everything food Holy. This place is so amazing and the bartender Russ knows the wines, appetizers, salads and entrees like Michael Angelo knows his brushes. This is the best Italian food I've EVER had and I've been to some of the best in NY, San Fran, Houston, New Orleans etc. The pizza dough is homemade, the sauce is homemade, the pasta - yep, from frick'n SCRATCH people!   I'll be in Charlotte next weekend and hitting this joint again my friends!!!  What a find!  Go here and your welcome!  I've now dined at this restaurant close to 10 times. I've had their amazing pizza and many entrees and appetizers from their menu. Tonight was the first time I felt slighted. I ordered the squash blossom appetizer and pepperoni pizza. Squash blossoms were a total home run as they have always been. The pizza arrived with pepperoni AND sausage that I did not order. They quickly apologized and it wasn't too long presented me with a pepperoni pizza that was dripping in grease. So much grease that the grease and cheese produced an emulsification that looked a little like an oil spill. Really disappointed because I KNOW this isn't their standard. I normally would have pointed it out but we'd already had the sausage mishap and it's already been a long 4 days on the road you know.   I will be back tomorrow to have an entree and expect to be back on track with what I know is a great restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

seYZHyktR1dRFNfBB4z1Vg.text: Best Italian spot Iv been to in a looooong time! Came here for a dinner Friday night. There were 4 of us and we all pretty much shared everything.  We ordered: the zucchini blossoms and the octopus for apps and the ravioli with the farm egg, the lamb agnolotti, the gnocchi for dinner and the orange honey butter cake and gelloti/sorbetti for dessert. Everything was phenomenal. I would say the three things that stood out to me to most were the ravioli with that egg and that amazing brown butter sauce, then the octopus and lastly that orange cake! Would highly recommend all three if you go. And in general I'd just highly recommend go here!!!! I myself can't wAit to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Potato Gnocchi
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charred Octopus

QaLwGzuu0mo9PEQ6Rzz3JA.text: Amazing place, amazing food, amazing service and amazing drinks and wine. I've visited this place at least 6 times in the last 4 months. Highly recommend it!

wgy_ZvPVFUk5nXF7Cghf0Q.text: Let me start off by saying anyone that knows me knows I "don't like Italian"...but I love this place! The menu was surprisingly diverse and non-traditional, which spoke to the foodie in me. We ordered the octopus and it was amazing. Small in size, but mighty in taste. Perfectly charred with nice and crispy potatoes. The mussels were also really good and flavorful. My husband ordered the lamb tortellini...delicious! Lamb is one of our favorites and this didn't disappoint. I ordered the lamb pizza (lol) and the lamb sausage was uber flavorful. Gooey cheese and thin-ish crust. Love! We will definitely go back.

3b3IAab3chAEINepRtGYqA.text: A friend recommended that we try Stagioni's for a fun night out. We went on a Saturday, and if you go I highly recommend getting a reservation. Over the phone they said our party of 5 would be a tight fit, but when we arrived we had a prime spot towards the front of the kitchen which was amazing because you can see all of your food being prepared. The building has a cozy front bar area and opens up into a romantic dining room with warm lighting. I'd highly recommend this place for a date night.   After pouring over the menu, our troop couldn't hardly make any decisions on what to eat. We ended up leaving most of the deciding up to our server which was a great choice! She picked some unique meats and cheese for us to try on a charcuterie board. The house-made capicola and bresaola were two of our favorites.  PRO TIP: When you're ordering dinner, put in your order for the special Zeppoli fried "doughnuts." They are heavenly and can take a moment to be prepared. My friend who recommended this spot ordered these first and at the conclusion of our meal we were so glad she did. Piping hot fried little pieces of dessert heaven.  Next it was a pizza to split, because we saw a few coming out around us and we couldn't pass it up. It came out with pizza shears which were interesting (though probably not the most functional). We tried the Broccoli pizza which was a great unique combination of broccoli, mozzarella, and chili oil. I also remember they had a pepperoni pizza that sounded amazing and a brussels sprout pizza. The dough tasted so homemade and fresh. If I were to go back, I'd definitely try another one of their creations.   For dinner I settled on the scallop and pasta dish of the evening. I love ordering seafood out at fine dining restaurants since I tend to cook more chicken and turkey at home. The scallops were buttery and the pasta was perfection. Everything melted in my mouth.  Our waitress was so helpful and paired 2 bottles of wine with our meal that made us feel extra fancy. This is definitely a special occasion type place and I recommend that you come VERY hungry. Fit for foodies!

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great for a group!
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scallops and the best bites of pasta I&#39;ve ever had!
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Apps! Do not skip the pizza

KV3Mi9bd-nSCh-zzRSJeKQ.text: Really good food and good service, but I can't get over how dark it is in the restaurant. Please turn the lights up so I can not only see my food but also see where I'm walking!!  Lighting aside, we enjoyed a fantastic meal at Stagioni. Our waiter wasn't terribly knowledgeable about the wine menu, which would have been helpful since many varietals we weren't familiar with. But once we got to the food, he knew what he was talking about! He pointed out the top two pasta dishes, which we ended up ordering, and they were really fantastic.   I'd also like to shout out the zeppoli for dessert, but please only order one for your table - it's massive!

867oeaLrMRSylIyarWhXGA.text: I love this restaurant.  I could leave it there, but I'll say more:  I arrived last night at 6:15pm for a 7:15pm reservation.  I couldn't kill time at my office anymore... so I figured I'd just arrive early... The hostess (whose name I didn't catch, mea culpa!) was so sweet... I was about to offer to wait at the bar when she said that my table was ready... so off I went...  As I had plenty of time, I ordered the Alternative (a bourbon, muddled orange, cointreau cocktail that is their current spin on the Old Fashioned... made with Bulleit) while I browsed the wine list.  This drink is absolutely delicious, and perfect to whet the appetite!  We trickled in one by one and Jenny, our server, was beyond attentive to us, waiting patiently until we all arrived to run down the specials and additional menu items for us...  She was a GEM and we were so lucky to have her as our server last night!   SO... for the table, we ordered two bottles of a lovely Tuscan Cab Sauv (Tommasi poggio al tufo toscana cabernet sauvignon 2016 to be exact); a cheese tray with their extra buffalo milk cheese that was very much a brie style cheese and absolutely fabulous; and a plate of the Cacio e Pepe to share... I had already scarfed a side salad because I was starving...  I then ordered the small plate of duck leg with a butternut squash risotto AND the sweet potato gnocchi... and THEN (because why the hell not?) we shared the chocolate tartufo... holy hell... I could die happy!    The duck was crispy on the outside, hot and tender on the inside, and atop that gently sweet risotto it was heaven on a plate!  The gnocchi were little floofs (yes, floofs) of heaven surrounded by a spicy and cheesy sauce and warm earthy sausages... I just can't even with these people!  The food is TOO good.   Let me tell you more about the food here... orgasmic doesn't cover it... It's made with so much love and care that the devotion to their craft shines through EVERY bite.  The servers here operate on another level as well.   Their patience and graciousness makes me feel (with EVERY visit) that I've been welcomed into someone's home rather than a business... This restaurant has EARNED its reputation.  It is, in my opinion, one of Charlotte's finest.  You'll pay for your meal, you'll tip like a king.  You won't mind.  I promise you!

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. The gnocchi!
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. The duck!!

H3WGNOwpFFXFYSUoiFuL-g.text: Ok, first off I'm not one to write bad reviews but this is a little ridiculous. Tonight a friend and I dined at Stagioni for the first time since it was close to where we took a gym class. I ordered a pepperoni pizza with no sausage and received a sausage pizza with no pepperoni. Not a big deal. The waiter was very apologetic and offered to swap it out, but since I had already started eating it I passed.  Before leaving I placed an order of the gnocchi to bring home to my husband and stupidly on my part I didn't check the box before leaving the restaurant. The attached picture is the gnocchi that was packaged up for me to go. As you can imagine after paying almost $30 for a dish I expected a little more than a few pieces... I'm actually mind blown by this.... was this someone else's to go food or is that really the restaurant portion? Unacceptable

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

lrm4s-Kr13XIpEwxXlTF3g.text: TLDR version: Lovely restaurant with great service. Expensive with small portions.  There is a lot to like about the feel of Stagioni. There menu is interesting, with unique proteins like rabbit. The service is warm. The cocktails are well crafted, the wine selection very diverse.  However, if I measure it dollar for dollar with similar establishments it is a case of Myers Park pricing. If someone else was paying this review would have an extra star. With my pocket book on the table I would go elsewhere.  Our waiter was divine, making us off menu cocktails based on our taste preferences. Recommending wine based on our feedback - and there is a value to that. At the end of the night my husband left hungry after an app and a very meaty entree. No one wants a hangry husband.

x26H0fohej9BZFa1iAR8-A.text: Got really excited when I heard this place had the same ownership as Good Food on Montford as that is my True favorite restaurant in Charlotte.  Also knowing the lack of Italian restaurants in this city, I figured I would have visited this place by now.  I really like the location and was surprised to find they even had ample parking around back and the design and ambiance inside really brings sets the scene for a modern, upscale family run traditional Italian feel.  First off I'd really like to compliment the cocktail list, I had the Vespa which is a brandy drink and it was one of my all-time favorites.  Couldn't recommend this more if you are a cocktail type.  As far as food goes, I really will need to go again as I only had the pizza and dessert but both were fantastic.  I really like this place as a special occasion type and I would say my only complaint is that its a little pricey for the portion sizes from what I observed.  However, with all this place has to offer from both food and dining experiences, many people including myself, will be back because it worth the price in many ways.  Will return.  Food: 8.5/10 Drinks:  10/10 Ambiance: 10/10 Price: 4/10 Service: 8/10 Value: 6/10

J4zzndkQQtW44WB_RAGhqQ.text: I've been to Stagioni several times and somehow, this restaurant has managed to knock it out of the party Every...Single...Time. The ambiance is so cozy, from the dim lights to the warmth coming from the kitchen. When you walk in, the first thing you see is the bar area. Walk a little further in to see a mid size dining room with an open kitchen in the back.  I went here on a First Dinner Date with my boo. Apparently drinks went so well the week before that he decided to go big or go home by booking an impressive reso at Stagioni. Since then, we've been on several other dates and group dinners here. It's just lively enough where you get a bottle of wine and have a great time, while being just quiet enough to hear each other.   Honestly, I recommend the whole menu. Their pizza is delicious, the pastas are fresh, and the main courses are perfectly packed with flavor. There isn't one thing on their menu that isn't well thought out and amazing.  If you haven't been yet, I recommend making a reso ASAP!

IbtEIebyBwS6T0gowUFNfw.text: Overall food is very good including the pizza. I would have given the review 4 stars except for the fact they charged me $31 for a pasta dish with clams (rec'd 6) and each clam was the size of an aspirin. I didn't know a clam could be that tiny, it was so small I couldn't chew it or taste it. The pasta was fresh & sauce was good so basically the microscopic clams ruined the dish for me.

hT3mhy6GNVUTbPt6hAr9rg.text: This restaurant was great!! The hostess was super friendly and had us seated at the pizza bar to avoid the wait. We ordered a bottle of wine, oysters, a pizza and pasta. The oysters and pizza were amazing; the pasta was good but nothing special. Overall it was a very pleasant date night experience and I would definitely come back. The menu was amazing and I want to try lots of their other dishes!

Rzp9oGArRyepaOgFhZaADw.text: I really try not to jump into the "anti social media" feeding frenzy of posting every bad experience and this was one I was going to keep in house but upon going to the website to send a private note to the manager there is not a "contact us" tab that I could readily find which struck me as the extreme attitude I experienced here.  Quickly I was very excited to meet a close local friend and her precocious daughter, who's manners are above reproach.  Ironically her father is a "name" in Charlotte hospitality but names do not matter, every well mannered customer is entitled to gracious service!  It was one of those bitter New York frigid days, we both got there about 5:15 and were waiting patiently outside for the 5:30 open.  About 5:20 a delivery person knocked on the locked door, a dressed gentleman opened the door for him, looked at us, closed the door and locked it.   We were both just astounded and left for some where more welcoming.

1y_Zj1SsEph_7t9BX_areA.text: This restaurant has a great ambience and is one of the better in the city. While I have found the pasta to be less than al dente in the past, the pizzas are always wonderful! Especially Tartufi!  Two pizzas can easily be shared and thoroughly enjoyed.  Matter fact, just skip it and eat at their sister restaurant Good Food.

ZsoUE3HHriZaWOWpgNm6Bg.text: This restaurant was an extreme disappointment. My husband and I have been wanting to try it since the reviews have been good and we love their sister restaurant, Good Food. It was also not easy to get a reservation last minute so we assumed a hot spot would not disappoint. The highlight of the experience was the wine. I ordered three different glasses of red and all were delicioius. Our waitress was friendly but she obviously had too many tables. The food was extremely slow from one course to the next. We waited at least 20-25 minutes between our appetizer and entree. We ordered the stuffed peppers as a snack. They were edible but nothing special, we wouldn't order them again. I had the pumpkin soup as my appetizer and my husband had the fig tart special. The pumpkin soup was good but I expected it to be thicker and more hearty. The fig tart was o.k. but heavy for an appetizer and over-priced. My husband ordered the $30 pasta entree special with truffle mushrooms. In the 4 years we've been dining together, we have never sent an entree back to the kitchen. This was an exception. The pasta literally had zero flavor. It tasted like noodles with a little butter that you would serve to a 5 year old. The waitress happily switched his dish for the rigatoni, which was just as bad. The pasta was cooked just fine but the small amount of sauce served over the dish was watery and flavorless. I ordered the trout. It lacked flavor and the portion was definitley small for the price. All in all I would give this restaurant a 2 out of 10 based on the wine. $150 and we left still hungry. We will NOT be back.

T0a3YgQY5cJziGN-o2SzpA.text: Awful. The noise level is deafening. Right after the four of us paid paid several hundred dollars for dinner, we were asked to vacate our table because someone else was waiting for it. Wait, what?! None of us will ever go there again nor will we recommend it. Too bad because one of the group is on the board of a large public company HQ in Charlotte. Stagioni won't get a second chance to make a good first impression.

C4-aTdHLvB9A1S2ofssf1g.text: We arrived shortly before 7:00 and grabbed a seat at the bar.  The bartender greeted us and took our drink order.  After checking over the menu we decided to try the charcuterie plate, a mixed array of meats, cheeses, etc.  However, unfortunately we received the special plate which was a little bit of an array of things that we were unfamiliar with, and no one gave us an explanation upon delivery. We tasted a few things, but unfortunately the chicken liver mouse and some of the other things, still not sure what they were, not to our liking. We explained the mix up and we were able to replace it with a plate of prosiutto de parma, mortadella, and variety of cheeses and olives, more what we were looking for. We also chose the swordfish appetizer which was served with crostini  and was pretty good. Finally we went with the margarita pizza, which was probably the best thing we had the entire night. Unfortunately throughout the evening the bartender was less available, leaving us with empty drinks for quite some time.  Overall, I thought the food we tried was good, and I really liked the atmosphere of the restaurant, However, I was a little disappointed with the overall service and attentiveness to delivery of our meals. I do look forward to going back, sitting in the restaurant and trying some more entrees, especially the pasta. It looked great.

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from the bar into the restaurant.
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar Selection

87KOWYjV6b84hoztCy20dg.text: Staggionis is awesome , we had an amazing meal. 1. Service was great and fast and efficient, staff was totally in tune for great dining experience  2. The restaurant is beautiful and charming. 3. Now to the food: The Mussels were amazingly good , must have The pork belly was good, but I wouldn't order it again  The gnocchi was seriously heavenly-order this! The fettuccini with pork ragu was sooo good! The cannoli with pistachio gelato was perfect ending and my girlfriend got the zeppoli and she is still raving about them! Overall a must go to in Charlotte

opExkneMJBaqYHtSS2L6wg.text: This was a big party of 10 - we all wanted to try this beautiful restaurant that we had seen from Providence Rd. They were able to work with our people and all the orders. We had a few of the appetizers, ..Fried Clam Strips...good tasting batter but very Chewy! Shisitto Peppers that were the bomb!! So good,  fresh grilled and dusted with flaky sea salt! Mushrooms that were ..just okay.  On to the Wine...all bottles extremely expensive..very hard to pick between a 42 and 38 when all the rest  jump up to 50 - 60 and on up.. They really should change this and put in a few less expensive wines..Entrees are very high..starting with Pastas for 18.00 and Up and they are small portions. I had the Carmalized Onion and Truffle Oil Pizza. It was good but very sweet, like it was a Onion Jam on the top. Some of our party had the Grouper ( 30.00) and liked it. Others had the Gnocchi with Pork Sugo and said it was delicious.  Best part of the evening was the Zeppole. Perfect , light and fresh ! .The other winners was the Peach skillet cake. .. I would go back for dessert and  perhaps a coffee...non was offered to us. Also no Parm...whats an Italian place without Parm????

vA7U9t2lKQz7LKIjdj0wdw.text: I can not say enough Good Things about Stagioni's from the moment I walked in I felt welcome! We were Warmly Greeted by the Manger and we were seated immediately. The Staff came over to our table immediately and served us water and warm bread while we looked over the menus.  The Decor puts you in the mind of Tuscany and is very appeasing to the eye. The intricate details gives your eye something new to explore at all times.  The Kitchen is open to the restaurant so you are able to get a peak at all of the delicious food that is coming out! The best thing about all the pastas and breads are that they are made in house!  Being that I was with a Group of Friends we decided to order an array of different dishes and drinks to do tastings. We order the Meatball Pizza, Rigatoni, Steak Florentine, and my all time favorite the Mushroom Risotto!! It was so good! We topped everything off with the tiramisu cheesecake it will not disappoint!!!   I would say this is a Great Place for Date Night and socializing with friends! Be sure to make reservations early this place fills up quick.

PguN8HgmdekpaUdgJr7-vw.text: Just finished a fabulous meal here with my wife. We had the 3 Antipasti, Eggplant, Olives, and Ricotta Spread. Added the mortadella for good measure. All were fabulous. Secondi, we had the mussels and the squash blossoms. The squash blossoms were outstanding, and the mussel broth with saffron is just amazing. We split the fish of the day, NC grouper. Again, very well prepared. Throw in the tart of the day, and the chocolate tart as well, and a very solid meal for two. The service was spot on. When we go back, we'll go with at least two other couples, so we can do family style. So many good options.

us_hw-q2ZcYdYc96AtWgxA.text: We had two apps, $13.00 for 3 pork meatballs and $15.00 for a fig tart that was to sweet that it should have been a dessert rather than an app. Place is way expensive for Italian food. The wine menu again is very expensive for the selection, same glass of pinto at wolfgangs is $3.00 less cheaper. Glad we tried it but you pay for the Myers Park area instead of quantity and quality of the food.

bYYVh8mt_gN_2FOiztqBWw.text: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at Stagioni. The service was wonderful - friendly, attentive, and gave great recommendations. Even offered to take a photo of us when they saw us attempting a self-timer shot outside.   We started with an octopus appetizer, which was delicious. So tender, and a great mix of flavors.   My husband ordered the pesce fresco which was grouper. I ordered the cannelloni with lamb bolognese. Both were fresh, interesting takes on the dishes. I expected ground lamb but it was finely shredded. The cannelloni was a rich dish, but so flavorful!   I only wish we'd had room for dessert. I heard the fried bread dipped in caramel sauce is excellent. Speaking of bread, I ate way too much of it prior to our food arriving. So so good.   Also loved the atmosphere. So yeah, five stars it is.

7XmOYNi7T0RojoQ9jRX7sg.text: I have been to Stagioni several time, and each time I got different experience. last time I was there after we were greeted and seated I asked for a bold and dry wine and not fruity, and my waitress called someone who apparently was expert. She asked for my price range which was kind of awkward and I said $50-$60 and she answered with this price range you won't have that many good option. ;-( which I thought it was kind of disrespectful. So she finally chose one of them which was exactly $60. My wine was smooth and fruity ,NOT BOLD, NOT DRY. our waitress just open the wine and filled our glasses and that was the only time she served us and we poured the entire bottle in our glasses since she did not notice our glasses were low. I googled my wine and here is the link: the wine was average $13 and sold on variety from $11 to $22. wine-searcher.com/wine-1... I am a foodie person and a wine lover. I will not trust their wine list any more. Ask them if you can take your wine and pay the cork fee.

Fm1d0m6i-ddxyBD953oUNg.text: I was fortunate to try Stagioni on one of the "Friends and Family" opening nights and I liked it so much that I went back 2 nights later!  In fact I was scoping out the menu on that first night and figuring out that whatever we didn't order that night I would just get on my next trip in.  For me there was never a question of not liking this place, Barrington's and Good Food are my favorite restaurants in Charlotte and I knew this place was going to be on par, if not better because its Italian and I LOVE Italian food!!  The design really is beautiful, from the floors, to the bathroom chandelier, to the cool picture spread out over the dining room ceiling, you can tell a lot of work went into making this place look good.  But the most important part, the food and drinks!  I have only had beer and wine so far, prosecco on tap, how cool is that??  I like that there is a whole section of spreads, my favorite was the ricotta, I could have licked the bowl clean but that would have been inappropriate so I stopped myself.  The red pepper and truffled cauliflower are good too, but the ricotta is just so creamy and light.    Arancini were delish, but how can you mess up fried balls of rice?  The braciole was another standout, as was the meatball pizza, the brodetto and the fettuccine.  But my new favorite thing in the whole world is the stracci, seriously I have been telling anyone who will listen to order this dish.  It was homemade ribbon pasta, huge shrimp, and pistachios in a light tomato saffron broth.  It was so amazing we were all fighting over who got to finish this dish.  I know I am missing some things but I am sure you get the point, pretty much everything its delicious.  Finally, dessert.  They have the pear skillet cake on their menu that Good Food used to have, its served with avocado ice cream and some salted caramel and its truly one of the most unique and delicious desserts I've ever eaten.  I was so sad when GF took it off their menu so I was very happy to see it here.  I also tried the zeppoli's and they were different than other zeppoli's I have had, much lighter so I almost felt like I was being healthy (haha) but still very good.  Overall, I was very impressed with Stagioni.  Usually when a restaurant is brand new you expect to have a lot of issues with food and service but I had 2 great experiences and plan on going back again this week, I mean a girl can only go so long without her stracci!!

giBKdJyLdpL1UGJAehJuoA.text: What a find last night. We had a 6pm reservation and got there early so we decided to hit the bar. Jesse, the bartender was extremely knowledgable about their vast selection of wine. A member of our party who typically chooses the wine even made a comment about how helpful she was.   After drinks we made our way the the table and ordered a huge charcuterie board filled with meats and cheeses. Nothing disappointed. Next was the meatballs the Brussel sprouts pizza. I was conflicted on the pizza but soooo glad we tried it. I would easily recommended it if it's on the menu if you visit.   For mains we had a split between pastas and meats. All were amazing.   You get the idea that the food is good but I really would focus on the customer service here. The waitstaff was so accommodating and we never had to ask for anything, they were always one step ahead. The food came quick and was always hot and the staff would check on multiple occasions is the food was prepared properly and if our table required anything. For only being open 4 months, that's impressive.   Definitely check this place out. It will not disappoint.

vwK9b-7vmOjmORov9LMJjg.text: Cool atmosphere, excellent service and great food make for a 5 star review. Date night or group dinner, this place is worth it. The wine list is ALL Italian and it's not small. All the pasta is made fresh daily. The fettuccine with pork ragu was delicious and hearty. Try to snacks, especially the mozzarella crostini.

gSUFFGCH80jEFkO_C44Rlg.text: Went here for my birthday in August, and I'm glad I finally tried it out.  The lobster gnocchi was good, though I was a bit disappointed with the serving size- I knew I wouldn't get a ton of lobster, but I was hopping for more gnocchi.  My girlfriend got the lamb rigatoni, which was amazing!  So freaking good, I would recommend it for anyone.  The atmosphere of the place is nice, but it got really loud in there as dinner progressed- guess it's just a small place that everything echoes.  Service was decent, but our server vanished in the middle of the meal; fortunately, nothing was wrong with our dishes, but I feel like it's standard for someone to stop by and check.  Overall, I would definitely recommend Stagioni, but maybe recommend that you try it during the week when it might be a bit quieter.

hkosGQNhyeYOYMTmy_P-SA.text: We came here a few weeks ago.  Overall, it was pretty good and we would go back again.  We started with the crostini and choices of spreads, all pretty decent.  I had the brussel sprout pizza sans the meat and it was pretty good.  Although, it could use maybe a little more depth in flavor when the meat isn't present.  I have to applaud them for being creative enough to use parsnip puree as the sauce.  My husband tried the agnolotti and he said it was pretty good. As a side note, I really didn't dig the decor.  It just didn't seem to all go together.  I didn't deduct any points for this, but I wasn't impressed at all by it.

OkZ72xxKePtZdPdyqvszdg.text: This place is the perfect place for comfort food!! Patrick is the greatest sever/manager made my visit so welcoming and fun!   I'm so lucky to have enjoyed it!!   Who knew there was a mini castle tucked away on Providence rd. in Charlotte, NC!!   I feel my life has seriously changed!   The ambience is dim and perfect for intimate groups. Very warm cozy and small. Reservations highly recommend for weekend dining. Unless you can score seats at the pizza oven bar which is first come first serve.   Decor was not what I was expecting but who cares when you're drinking wine and eating great food with great company.   I ordered the gnocchi and it was to die for. Warm and fresh but also light and comforting. It was one of the pasta dishes with protein. Pork to be exact.  Honestly if I was having a bad day I could just come here and it would turn my frown upside down!!

YDM7V1j0XIUMRsWK5D7TMQ.text: Visited Stagioni with my parents and was wowed by the creativity of the dishes, the flavor and service. Our waiter was super attentive and gave us recommendations in each section of the menu - all of which were extremely solid since we ordered some of his recos. I had the tartufi pizza, which comes with its own set of scissors to cut into slices. So fun and effective. The pizza was slightly sweet from the bed of caramelized onions on the crust, layered with fresh mozzarella and tons of wild mushrooms and a generous swirl of truffle oil that adds a delicious earthy flavor to the pizza. My parents ordered the truffles cauliflower to start - a delicious and rich dip served with paper thin crackers. Highly recommend. My dad ordered the Caesar salad, which was gently dressed with the most aromatic croutons. My mom then ordered the cavatelli - short cut, curled pasta with lots of veggies and a light sauce. Really lovely. My dad ordered the spaghetti with scallops and literally cleaned his plate. Everything was delicious. We can't wait to come back here as soon as possible and try everything else on the menu! Maybe tomorrow...!

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Truffles cauliflower with crackers
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tartufi pizza

tyjz57lWigcXhVxR2bzNBg.text: Really enjoyed this place. I would've given 5 stars but for the extremely slow service. And by that I mean the kitchen, not the wait staff. Russ was as attentive and friendly as is possible on a busy Saturday night. It seemed like the kitchen was either unprepared or understaffed. That said, what finally made it to our table was worth the wait. We had the Buratta and a Ceasar salad. Both were quite good. But the Prosciutto Pizza we shared for our main was phenomenal. Interestingly enough, between the wonderful food and the quite European service, we felt like we were back in Italy!  If you want plenty of time to put down your cell phone and talk with your dinner mate, this is a great spot. If your planning a first date and allocating an hour, not so much. We like to talk to each other and we love good Italian food, so we'll be back.

TGvFQTNc7NnO3kfkif9Owg.text: Bar hopping for Tapas tonight. 4th stop of the evening. Fabulous mussels! Unexpected cream broth with a wonderful flavor. Tega Hills salad was fabulous. Place was packed. Reservation are probably a must, but we sat right down at the bar and ordered. Servers are super friendly and we'll trained on their product. We will be back for a full reservation in the near future.

eeFNOvjk3QZk1rrL65VuqQ.text: My wife and I went there last night . We had a 545 res and decided to have a cocktail at the bar since it was only 515. Note we were the only ones in the restaurant s few minutes later the bartender throws out bill at us  I ask her what r u doing?? I only had s sip of my drink and this place is completely empty immediately the mgr comes over and explains to us if they don't rush all their patrons they will not b able to turn the tables 3 times s night. So rude the mgr then asks can I seat u at your table?? We answered every table is empty so here's my credit card and we walked next store to Napa. At Napa they treated us like kings and had a terrific meal. Good bye stagion u deserve to go out of business!!!!! Never had such a bad experience in a totally empty place.

6YCklk7zn-TXDpjR10cJxw.text: Perfect!  Fantastic flavors, well educated wait staff & comfortable setting.  I'll be back!

yfoOecspIttr69St87Cuog.text: Went here for a Xmas party.  Took about 10 minutes to get my first glass of wine and waiting over 15 for a refill.  The appetizers were very messy and just okay.  The fish entree was good, but such a small portion that I went home and ate again.  I'm pretty small and normally have leftovers.  I will not be back.

V_VWwMwLMV4VqvgIb5siWw.text: Let me explain for my slightly harsh review. I had super high expectations of this place because of heir sister restaurant, Good Food on Montford, which happens to be my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I think the Muffett Group have what it takes and can take a critic or two from a fan to give them the push  The decor itself bothers me. I can't put my finger on it. The tables are so close together I almost took a spoonful of my right hand diners risotto.   I love Prosecco and they happen to have have it on tap, sounds awesome right? It did To me too until I had it. It tastes like Brut rather than Prosecco, it was dry not sweet but I love bubbles so that wasn't entirely a complaint (drank it with ease).   I am convinced that The fried chickpeas are dehydrated and not made in house but unexpected so I give them that. However all the other antipastos aka appetizers we had fell short. I happened to really enjoy the Brussel Sprout Pizza, so unexpectedly delicious.   I ordered the veal saltimbocca was so disappointing. While my first few bites I really wanted to like it , the veal was really thin, then followed a layer of cheese and a layer of prosciutto- all this on top was amazing it over powered the veal. The creamy polenta was fantastic though.   I have tried to make it a point to only try desserts that are either a staple to the origin of the food served or if it sounds out of the norm...so I tried the Zeppolis which were an airy delight! I also tried the Pear Skilet Cake with Avocado ice cream , sounds amazing right? Yes but individually, not sure of they paired. Why not a salted cartelized bacon in the avocado ice cream? Just not with that cake. I leave it to them to fix.   Let me touch on service. The bread with olive oil was served while we were almost done with our appetizers , really? However our service hosts themselves were very friendly.  All in all, I'm hoping for a change to come the spring/summer. I hope I won't be disappointed, again.

k5vSlQYoNMBzdimIoUCOpA.text: Date night after a long day at work. I really couldn't process what I wanted to order. Our waiter was like a damn food life coach. He basically ordered for me, all the way through apps to the enter. The place is absolutely 5 stars and one of the best spots CLT has to offer. If they served breakfast and I had a much larger paycheck I would eat here three (or more) times a day.

RUaQQtEeNVhrpFzml7S0RA.text: This is my absolute favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Never had a bad in experience in any way and I've been at least 10 times. The service is always amazing, the food  is ridiculous. It's a bit loud throughout the place but totally worth it.

YA-cVUChDHSMaf7uZ9iDFA.text: Kudos to the the owner for bringin' in an amazing new Chef! One of the most romantic compliments someone can get, is when another person sees a picture and simply states: There are no words. This food is like that.   Of course, I'll find some words, or else this would be a pointless review, right? And oh my, will there be words. I'm about to do some ramblin'!  We'll start with the starters. From their antipasto menu, we were blessed with the flavors of the Caprese and the Italian Sausage Crustini. Now, I have had my fair share of "caprese salads" as I love fresh mozzarella. But this was not only visually beautiful, but absolute flavor perfection. There were several varieties of tomatoes, each with their own flavor notes along with the perfect vinaigrette that was poignantly sweet and tart. This was all accented with mozzarella foam. Now, anything with the word 'foam' usually turns me off, as I'm not a gastro-food pro, however, this was exactly what this antipasto needed. Anything more would have thrown off the balance of this exquisite salad.  The Italian Sausage Crustini came out, and we thought of some sort of dank hot dog, however we were more than pleasantly surprised. The bread was light and fluffy and the sausage was not overpowering or heavy, but had the slightest hint of heat and pepper, all accented with a lovely sweet pepper sauce (which has a fancier name, but I can't remember it just now) that tied everything into a taste bud orgasm.  We also were honored with two specials for the evening, which may not be available for you when you go, and you should feel sad if they aren't. Fried squash blossoms stuffed with mascarpone and heaven, and a gazpacho that would rival a fine wine as it had notes of cucumber, melon and summer.  We decided on pasta entrees as we'd heard that the pasta is made in-house (and it's an Italian place). We had Agnolotti and the Spaghetti. Though I've never been to Italy, these entrees made me think that this is what I would be eating while dining on some patio overlooking the sea. Pasta that wasn't overloaded and heavy, but simply made you joyous while you chewed. The Spaghetti was served with little neck clams in a light angelic white wine sauce, and the Agnolotti? Oh. My. God. I am often wary of lobster, as so many chefs choose to use it, and so many chefs send out lobster that's rubbery and chewy. This lobster melted in my mouth. And the pasta was stuffed with, hold onto your seats folks, this amazing corn concoction...and I believe crack. Because I couldn't stop eating it. I was SO full, but my fork just kept moving because it was the perfect sweetness to go with the lobster, all in a light sauce that held the perfect hint of saltiness to blend the flavors into...well, that crack concoction I was referring to.  We didn't need dessert. We truly didn't, however the Zeppoli was 'forced' upon us, and we grudgingly acquiesced knowing at this point, that it would be amazing. And we were not disappointed. Light clouds of fried bread dusted with powdered sugar with a semi-sweet caramel dipping sauce. And...for once,...I simply don't have the words. When thinking about it, I just smile.  Everything we ate made us make noises that bordered on sexual bliss. I hate to call myself a "foodie" because I hate those people, but I eat a lot of good food in a lot of good restaurants, but this was simply a treat for our taste buds. And the service needs to be mentioned, as it was impeccable (ask for Jack). No empty plate lingered on our table, nor were we ever lacking anything, and he 'touched' the table with perfect timing. If you like to eat wonderfulness, and simply going to a place that's going to leave you longing for more, than this is definitely the place for you.  Bravo Chef Dodd! Well done. Very, very well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Stagioni Four Seasons of Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Terrible picture. Amaaaazing pasta!!

ptQEYHlgGgWyOr7Xpkbllw.text: Loved this place.  Our group has been coming to Charlotte for eleven months.  We try to eat at any restaurant that makes either a "top" list or is recommended to us by someone local.  To date, Stagioni is the best meal we have had.  The food was amazing.  The recommended cheese plate with pate was awesome.  The short rib was really good.  The wine pairing recommendations rounded out the meal.    Mindy rocks.  Service makes all the difference.  Mindy made great food and wine recommendations.  She checked in on us appropriately and was available when we needed it.  We would have enjoyed the dinner without Mindy, but we were glad she was there.  I am looking forward to eating there again next week.

fWxQBIXI47vyOFI7E-2sew.text: Food is excellent and ambiance is wonderful. ! The tartuffi pizza was great, as we're the gnocchi and squabs dishes. The zeppolis are amazing too. Highly recommend!!

OIPE2CvbZ0_MUP-3LLprVg.text: Been her 2x. 1st was phenomenal. 2nd time was fantastic in every manor except they unloaded the salt in a couple of our dishes beyond the normal restaurant salt/butter hit. If we were not somewhat pressed for time I would have sent it back. Really good food doesn't need the masking of a heavy salt download to the point of unbalancing the meal. If I go back I will clearly announce to take it easy on the salt.

JpimXNmMZu9lF4UDWwXZmg.text: 30$ and a drive down providence road will allow anyone to take a little (and I mean super tiny) trip to Europe and back. Stagioni is located in the cutest flat building that contains concrete columned walkways with intentionally chipped paint.  I just wish there were more nighttime things to do here because it would be the perfect romantic date spot.   As for the inside, the best description I can think of is "upscale hipster". The decorations are cozy with mixes between metals and wood, the light is dim, and most impressively: every single waiter had on a chambray shirt and nicely groomed beards. Props to Stagioni for finding these gentlemen with such hair growing talents.    The food was awesome. From appetizer to dessert, I couldn't stop myself from chowing down everything in front of me.  The menu changes but as of now, I'd recommend mussels for appetizer and short rib for entree. Let me tell you, those mussels are expensive but well damn worth that price tag.  But honestly in general Stagioni isn't unaffordable. We paid 80$ for 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and dessert. And we left completely stuffed like two turkeys on Thanksgiving.   Lastly, don't expect parking unless you come early (like 6ish). The lot is small and spots are very limited, especially when it's busy.

HRhkdcAq1SzM6GsQSVaqiw.text: OMG. Wher have you been hiding Stagioni? Ever changing beautiful menu. Wow, wow, wow. I had a gnocchi made to order that was better than I had in Rome. For dessert I had a homemade cannoli. I just about died. It was perfect and light and crisp and thin the way it's supposed to be. So going back!
